'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]]ing and [[online advertising]]. The company is based in [[Mountain View, California]], and has 10,674 full-time employees (as of [[December 31]], [[2006]]).<ref>"[http://www.google.com/press/pressrel/revenues_q406.html Google Announces Fourth Quarter And Fiscal Year 2006 Results]." January 31, 2007. Retrieved on [[February 1]], [[2007]].</ref> Google's mission statement is "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>"[http://www.google.com/corporate/ Google Corporate Information: Company Overview]." ''Google.'' Retrieved on January 6, 2007.</ref> Google's corporate philosophy includes statements such as, "You can make money without doing evil," and, "Work should be challenging and the challenge should be fun," illustrating a somewhat more relaxed corporate culture.
+
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]]ing and [[online advertising]]. The company is based in [[Mountain View, California]], and has 12,238 full-time employees (as of [[March 31]], [[2007]]).<ref>''New York Times'', April 20, 2007.</ref> Google's mission statement is "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>"[http://www.google.com/corporate/ Google Corporate Information: Company Overview]." ''Google.'' Retrieved on January 6, 2007.</ref> Google's corporate philosophy includes statements such as, "You can make money without doing evil," and, "Work should be challenging and the challenge should be fun," illustrating a somewhat more relaxed corporate culture.
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]], and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on September 7 1998. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States Dollar|$]]1.67 billion, making it worth $23 billion.<ref name="washpost">Webb, Cynthia L. "[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A14939-2004Aug19.html Google's IPO: Grate Expectations]." ''[[Washington Post]].'' August 19, 2004. Retrieved on [[February 25]], [[2007]].</ref> Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial search and advertising business into other areas, including web-based [[email]], online mapping, office productivity, and video sharing, among others.
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]], and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on September 7 1998. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States Dollar|$]]1.67 billion, making it worth $23 billion.<ref name="washpost">Webb, Cynthia L. "[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A14939-2004Aug19.html Google's IPO: Grate Expectations]." ''[[Washington Post]].'' August 19, 2004. Retrieved on [[February 25]], [[2007]].</ref> Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial search and advertising business into other areas, including web-based [[email]], online mapping, office productivity, and video sharing, among others.
